intro: Papaver monanthum var. obtusifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a wildflower and its potential use in traditional medicine.
